foi.whatIsDesc1: Freedom of Information (FOI) laws give citizens the right to access government documents, records, and data. They allow journalists, researchers, activists, and ordinary citizens to uncover government activities, expose corruption, and hold public officials accountable.

They require these bodies to respond to information requests within specified timeframes, though certain exemptions may apply for national security, personal privacy, or commercial confidentiality reasons.
